title: oc php errors when accessing sub folders (from owncloud.log)
body:
owncloud 5.0 beta 2 (aktuell), downloaded from github 27.02. ~08:30
ubuntu 12.04 (latest patches installed)
external storage support app enabled
granted the admin user 2 local drives which are mounted from ubuntu via smb

problem:
clicking into sub folders may work or bring you back to the root of files instead to the subfolder. takes place in the second layer.
structure:
root (files)
  folder_x
     sub_folder_layer_1
        sub_folder_layer_2
        ....
  folder_y
     sub_folder_layer_1
        sub_folder_layer_2
        ...
details:
- i change in files to folder_x (the smaller one) and afterwards to one or deeper sub folder, any layer - sporadically works. sometimes i immediate see the sub_folder_layer, sometimes i just have to reload the browser page tho show up the contents (but it shows up). no error is logged.
eg: folder_x
       sub_folder_layer_1
          sub_folder_layer_2    <-- behaviour starts from here

- if i change into the bigger folder and afterwards into one of the sub folders, i get errors. oc either jumps back to the root of files instead of the sub folder (first try) or has a blocked screen (second try).
eg: folder_x
       sub_folder_layer_1
          sub_folder_layer_2     <-- error

the undefined variable message comes first. if i retry, i get the second message

{"app":"php","message":"undefined variable: s at \/mnt\/www\/owncloud\/lib\/l10n\/de.php#37","level":2,"time":1361952943}

and

{"app":"php","message":"sqlstate[hy000]: general error: 5 database is locked at \/mnt\/www\/owncloud\/lib\/db.php#949","level":4,"time":1361953388}

it is interresting, that this behaviour is clearly differenciated between the two folders. sub_folder_layer_2 behaviour is folder dependent without any visible reason.

info:
if i get a blank screen from the second try and i overwrite the browser path from:
  https://xxxx/owncloud/index.php/apps/files?dir=//yyyy
  https://xxxx/owncloud/index.php/apps/files?dir=/yyyy         (// -> /)
i get back to the root of files
